snippet: A federal judge will determine if a provision of the company’s July 2009 bankruptcy agreement shields it from lawsuits over a defective ignition switch.
abstract: Federal bankruptcy Judge Robert E Gerber hears arguments in case that will decide fate of key provision in 2009 bankruptcy agreement that shields General Motors from most legal claims regarding vehicles manufactured before that date; company is attempting to shut down scores of lawsuits related to defective ignition switch in many such models; Gerber's initial comments signal that he will be more skeptical than in 2009 case.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge will determine if a provision of the company’s July 2009 bankruptcy agreement shields it from lawsuits over a defective ignition switch.

headline.main: Judge Hears Arguments Over G.M.’s Exposure to Recall Suits
headline.print_headline: Judge Hears G.M.’s Case in Recalls
